title: 113_hr4917
content: The "Medical Bankruptcy Fairness Act of 2014" may be cited as the short title. Definitions are provided in Section 2. The "Medical Bankruptcy Fairness Act of 2014" provides definitions for terms related to medical debt, including 'medical debt' and 'medically distressed debtor'. The "Medical Bankruptcy Fairness Act of 2014" defines terms related to medical debt and medically distressed debtors, including criteria for debts not paid by third-party payors and domestic support obligations due to medical issues. The curr_chunk discusses circumstances where an obligor may be exempt from meeting certain requirements under the "Medical Bankruptcy Fairness Act of 2014" due to changes in employment status resulting in reduced wages or unemployment caused by injury, illness, or caregiving responsibilities. The curr_chunk amends Section 104 of title 11, United States Code, to include exemptions for debtors affected by changes in employment status due to injury, illness, or caregiving responsibilities. The curr_chunk provides exemptions for debtors affected by changes in employment status due to injury, illness, or caregiving responsibilities. The curr_chunk introduces amendments to Section 522 of title 11, United States Code, allowing medically distressed debtors to exempt up to $250,000 in value of property used as a residence. The amendments to Section 522 of title 11, United States Code allow debtors to exempt property used as a residence, including a cooperative or burial plot. SEC. 4. WAIVER OF ADMINISTRATIVE REQUIREMENTS. Amends Section 707(b) of title 11, United States Code for Chapter 7 cases and Section 1325(b)(1) for Chapter 13 cases to exclude medically distressed debtors. SEC. 5. CREDIT COUNSELING. Amends Section 109(h)(4) to include medically distressed debtors. SEC. 6. STUDENT LOAN UNDUE HARDSHIP. SEC. 6. STUDENT LOAN UNDUE HARDSHIP. Amends Section 523(a)(8) of title 11, United States Code to include medically distressed debtors. Requires debtors seeking relief as medically distressed debtors to file a statement of relevant medical expenses. SEC. 8. EFFECTIVE DATE; APPLICATION OF AMENDMENTS. This Act and its amendments take effect upon enactment, applying only to cases under title 11, United States Code, initiated after the enactment date.
